org.usefultoys.slf4j

Class LoggerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usefultoys.slf4j.LoggerFactory

  • public class LoggerFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    An alternative to LoggerFactory, with additional useful methods.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LoggerFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • getLogger

        public static org.slf4j.Logger getLogger(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a logger named according to the name parameter using the statically bound ILoggerFactory instance. Equivalent to LoggerFactory.getLogger(String).

        Recommended to get a special purpose logger defined by the application, whose name does not follow the fully qualified name convention and that tracks some globally available feature.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the logger.
        Returns:
        the logger

      • getLogger

        public static org.slf4j.Logger getLogger(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Returns a logger named according to the class passed as parameter, using the statically bound ILoggerFactory instance.

        Recommended to get a logger that tracks features provided by the class.

        Parameters:
        clazz - the returned logger will be named after clazz
        Returns:
        the logger

      • getLogger

        public static org.slf4j.Logger getLogger(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                         java.lang.String name)
        Returns a separate logger named according to a parent logger and the operation or feature, using the statically bound ILoggerFactory instance.

        Recommended to get a logger subordinated to an existing logger.

        Parameters:
        clazz - the returned logger will be named after clazz
        name - the name of operation or feature appended to the parent logger name.
        Returns:
        the logger

      • getLogger

        public static org.slf4j.Logger getLogger(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                                         java.lang.String name)
        Returns a separate logger named according to a parent logger and the operation or feature, using the statically bound ILoggerFactory instance.

        Recommended to get a logger subordinated to an existing logger.

        Parameters:
        logger - the returned logger will be named after this parent logger
        name - the name of operation or feature appended to the parent logger name.
        Returns:
        the logger

      • getTracePrintStream

        public static java.io.PrintStream getTracePrintStream(org.slf4j.Logger logger)
        Returns a PrintStream whose close and flush methods write its formatted text as a trace message to logger.
        Parameters:
        logger - the logger text is reported to.
        Returns:
        the PrintStream that writes its text to the logger.

      • getTracePrintStream

        public static java.io.PrintStream getTracePrintStream(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                                                      java.lang.String name)
        Returns a PrintStream whose close and flush methods write its structured text as a trace message to logger. Shortcut to getTracePrintStream(LoggerFactory.getLogger(logger, name)).
        Parameters:
        logger - the logger text is reported to.
        name - the name of operation or feature appended to the logger name.
        Returns:
        the PrintStream that writes its text to the logger.

      • getDebugPrintStream

        Parameters:

        name - the name of operation or feature appended to the logger name.
        Returns:
        the PrintStream that writes its text to the logger.

      • getErrorOutputStream

        public static java.io.OutputStream getErrorOutputStream(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                                                        java.lang.String name)
        Returns a OutputStream whose close and flush methods write its unformatted data as an error message to logger. unformatted data as a error level message to to the logger. Shortcut to getErrorOutputStream(LoggerFactory.getLogger(logger, name)).
        Parameters:
        logger - the logger data is reported to.
        name - the name of operation or feature appended to the logger name.
        Returns:
        the OutputStream that writes its data to the logger.
